TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SyndicationCategory extends System.Object

Docs.summary: A class that represents the category of a syndication feed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A category allows you to assign one or more keywords that can be used to search for information.
## Examples The following code shows how to create a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> and add a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> with a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The syndication object model allows you to add custom attributes to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> instance. Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. They are serialized as an attribute of the `<category>` element.

Docs.summary: Gets the element extensions for this category.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specification. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace.
## Examples The following XML shows how a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> with a custom element is serialized to Atom 1.0.
``` <category customAttribute="value" term="FeedCategory" label="CategoryLabel" scheme="CategoryScheme"> <customCategoryElement xmlns="">Some text</customCategoryElement> </category> ```
> [!NOTE] > Custom elements within <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> instances are not serialized to RSS 2.0.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Label { get; set; }
.property instance string Label
Public Property Label As String
public: property System::String ^ Label { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Label : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the label of the category.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Label%2A> is written to the `label` attribute of the <`category`> element. <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Label%2A> is not serialized to RSS 2.0.
## Examples The following XML shows how the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Label%2A> property is serialized to Atom 1.0.
``` <category customAttribute="value" term="FeedCategory" label="CategoryLabel" scheme="CategoryScheme"/> ```

public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Name : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the name of the category.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Name%2A> is written to the `term` attribute of the <`category`> element. <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Label%2A> is not serialized to RSS 2.0.
## Examples The following XML shows how the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Name%2A> property is serialized to Atom 1.0.
``` <category customAttribute="value" term="FeedCategory" label="CategoryLabel" scheme="CategoryScheme"/> ```

MemberSignature.Value: public string Scheme { get; set; }
.property instance string Scheme
Public Property Scheme As String
public: property System::String ^ Scheme { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Scheme : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the scheme of the category.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Scheme%2A> property is written to the `scheme` attribute of the <`category`> element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Scheme%2A> property is written to the `domain` attribute of the <`category`> element.
## Examples The following XML shows how the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Scheme%2A> property is serialized to Atom 1.0.
``` <category customAttribute="value" term="FeedCategory" label="CategoryLabel" scheme="CategoryScheme"/> ```
The following XML shows how the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Scheme%2A> property is serialized to RSS 2.0.
``` <category customAttribute="value" domain="CategoryScheme">FeedCategory</category> ```

Docs.param: The syndication version to use when parsing.
Docs.summary: Attempts to parse an attribute extension.
Docs.returns: A value that specifies whether the attribute extension was parsed successfully.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. They are serialized as an attribute of the `<category>` element. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom attribute extension. To do this, derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.
